radios.title: XeRW
radios.profile_slogan: XeRW Loves Music!

radio_info.short: A radio station with music and memories from the 50’s, 60’s and 70's. Inspired by the high power radio stations like XER, XERA, XERB and
radio_info.rest:
XERF broadcasting from across the Mexico/USA border and the European offshore stations like Radio Caroline, Radio England and Radio London that broadcast from the North Sea.

Heard of Wolfman Jack or Rosko?

Have you seen and enjoyed the films American Graffitti or The Boat That Rocked
Remember American diners, hot-rods, Ford Thunderbirds, mini-skirts, drive-in movies, and listening to the radio late at night. Or maybe you rode a Vespa or Lambretta, listened to soul music in cafes, and wore a two-tone suit?

Even if you are too young to have memories from the 50’s and 60’s, XeRW will take you back to those times when things really were new and exciting.

So as the Beach Boys said, let’s have some Fun, Fun, Fun!

radio_info.short: Here at "Ruff Start Radio" we believe in investing in the DJ's and sound & lighting engineers of the future! We created "Ruff Start Radio"
radio_info.rest: so that we could firstly play great music to people and also encourage new DJ's and sound & light engineers to learn the industry and become confident enough to play on the radio or maybe even... live on stage!  We have seasoned DJ's that play live on a regular basis and we will also hold events to showcase the newest talent, alongside all of this will be pre-recorded sets from our resident DJ's. There will be lots of genres played from house to hardcore and everything in between, so come join us at "Ruff Start Radio" and discover the next diamond DJ.

radios.title: Xtreme Radio
radios.profile_slogan: Making radio matter

radio_info.short: Xtreme Radio is a student radio station society at Swansea University in the city of Swansea, Wales run by a team of elected volunteer Executive
radio_info.rest:
members, and is located in Union House. Xtreme broadcasts on 1431AM and the station's website, and can also be heard around the student village of Hendrefoilan, the University campus itself, and Swansea.

The station was opened in November 1968, (making it the third oldest student radio station in the UK after University Radio York and University Radio Essex) and prior to becoming known as Xtreme Radio, the station had three previous incarnations - Action Radio, URA and C-Air.

radios.title: Calon FM
radios.profile_slogan: Uniting our community

radio_info.short: Calon FM is Wrexham’s own community radio station. Since March 2008 the station has built up its schedule to offer a wide range of shows
radio_info.rest:
for all tastes.

The station is growing every day and last year was nominated for a Times Higher Education Award for its work within the community supporting local schools and charities.

Calon FM is a social platform, which will enable all communities to educate, entertain and produce relevant programming to truly reflect the full diversity of the many different social and ethnic groups in Wrexham and beyond

The philosophy of Calon FM is to provide a channel to encourage and facilitate the empowerment, life long learning, development and generation of our community, regardless of race, gender, age or disability. We will achieve this goal through the inclusive development of training, community interaction, new media, communication, and education.

Do you have a local story you’d like to share? Got an event coming up or a charity venture you’d like to promote? Are you a local artist looking for somewhere to showcase your talent? Get in touch! Email on info@calonfm.com,call us on 01978 293 393, or contact us via our facebook page www.facebook.com/calonfm

Wrexham Matters – our new news  feature looking at local news stories affecting Wrexham. Got a story? Send us an email to info@calonfm.com or add us to your press mailing list.

radio_contacts.short: Calon FM is Wrexham’s own community radio station. Since March 2008 the station has built up its schedule to offer a wide range of shows
